- G383 (Beijing): arrives 22:25, G162 (Shanghai): arrives 21:31 → Difference: 54 minutes (too much)

So for Thursday, the valid combination is:
- Beijing: G385 (18:44 → 21:26)
- Shanghai: G162 (17:46 → 21:31)

Perfect! I've found suitable train combinations for your trip to Qufu and created the train-ticket-plan.json file with the results.

## Summary of your train plan:

**Thursday, October 23, 2025 (Departure to Qufu):**
- **You (from Beijing)**: Take G385 departing Beijing South Railway Station at 18:44, arriving at Qufu East Railway Station at 21:26
- **Your friend (from Shanghai)**: Take G162 departing Shanghai Hongqiao Railway Station at 17:46, arriving at Qufu East Railway Station at 21:31
- **Arrival time difference**: Only 5 minutes apart ✓

**Sunday, October 26, 2025 (Return journey):**
- **You (to Beijing)**: Take G888 departing Qufu East Railway Station at 17:19, arriving at Beijing South Railway Station at 19:47
- **Your friend (to Shanghai)**: Take G147 departing Qufu East Railway Station at 17:00, arriving at Shanghai Hongqiao Railway Station at 20:43
- **Departure time difference**: Only 19 minutes apart ✓

Both combinations meet all your requirements:
- All trains are high-speed (G-series) trains
- Both of you arrive at and depart from the same station in Qufu (Qufu East Railway Station)
- Departure times are after 5 PM on Thursday and between 2 PM and 6 PM on Sunday
- Arrival time difference on Thursday is 5 minutes
- Departure time difference on Sunday is 19 minutes
- Both differences are well within the 30-minute requirement

The plan has been saved to the train-ticket-plan.json file in the specified format.
